top_pain_points.pain: Threat detection models need to adapt quickly to new attack patterns
False positives from security ML models create alert fatigue
No visibility into why security models flag or miss certain threats
LLM-based security tools need quality monitoring for accuracy

winning_value_props.value: Rapid detection when threat models drift as attack patterns evolve
Reduce false positives by understanding model behavior
Quality monitoring for AI-powered security tools

common_objections.objection: We're in the security business - we're very careful about adding vendors
common_objections.effective_response: Understood - security companies have the highest standards. Arize works with security leaders including Proofpoint, Radiant Security, and Kandji. We can discuss deployment options that meet your security requirements.

common_objections.objection: Our threat detection models are highly proprietary
common_objections.effective_response: Arize monitors model behavior without exposing your detection logic. We analyze inputs, outputs, and performance metrics - not your threat signatures or algorithms. VPC deployment keeps all data in your environment.

discovery_questions.question: How do your threat detection models adapt when new attack patterns emerge?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: How quickly can you detect when models are missing new threats?

discovery_questions.question: What's your current false positive rate, and how do you manage alert fatigue?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: Can you identify which model behaviors cause most false positives?

discovery_questions.question: When investigating a security incident, can you understand why your models did or didn't flag something?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: Is that level of visibility sufficient for your analysts?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_no: Would that visibility improve investigation efficiency?
